tags: bless dt being all wonderful with the crowds
it's lovely that so many people wanted to see him
but unfortunate that it causes the production to slow down
what a lovely problem to have though
summary:
Behind the Scenes of The Next Doctor (Part 9) 

Russell T. Davies, as interviewed by Paul Connolly for The Daily Mail:

  
I'm...
caption:
Behind the Scenes of The Next Doctor (Part 9)

Russell T. Davies, as interviewed by Paul Connolly for The Daily Mail:

I’m not entirely sure why I was so determined to set this special in Victorian times. Partly, it’s that we haven’t done a Christmas show set in the past before - they tend to be in the present or the future - and I try to make it slightly different every year. But I also think there’s something about the Victorian age that just fits Doctor Who, somehow.

We did the filming in Gloucester- instead of Cardiff, where we usually film - because it has so many Victorian streets. But one of the obstacles now has become filming with David Tennant, because he gathers a crowd wherever he goes.

It’s extraordinary. I mean, the man’s a star. And he handles it so beautifully; he’s so brilliant with the public, but it does eat up our time! It makes filming that much slower and more laborious.

About 400 people turned up in Gloucester. This would never happen in Cardiff because we’re there all the time and people are quite used to us. In fact, they’ve become a bit blasé. Gloucester was lovely, though, absolutely beautiful, and the city was so willing to let us close off streets.

Other The Next Doctor parts available [one] [two] [three] [four] [five] [six] [seven] [eight]
[ Other behind-the-scenes photosets are available here ]

reblog.comment:
Behind the Scenes of The Next Doctor (Part 9)

I’m not entirely sure why I was so determined to set this special in Victorian times. Partly, it’s that we haven’t done a Christmas show set in the past before - they tend to be in the present or the future - and I try to make it slightly different every year. But I also think there’s something about the Victorian age that just fits Doctor Who, somehow.

We did the filming in Gloucester- instead of Cardiff, where we usually film - because it has so many Victorian streets. But one of the obstacles now has become filming with David Tennant, because he gathers a crowd wherever he goes.

It’s extraordinary. I mean, the man’s a star. And he handles it so beautifully; he’s so brilliant with the public, but it does eat up our time! It makes filming that much slower and more laborious.

About 400 people turned up in Gloucester. This would never happen in Cardiff because we’re there all the time and people are quite used to us. In fact, they’ve become a bit blasé. Gloucester was lovely, though, absolutely beautiful, and the city was so willing to let us close off streets.

trail.content_raw:
Behind the Scenes of The Next Doctor (Part 9)

Russell T. Davies, as interviewed by Paul Connolly for The Daily Mail:

I’m not entirely sure why I was so determined to set this special in Victorian times. Partly, it’s that we haven’t done a Christmas show set in the past before - they tend to be in the present or the future - and I try to make it slightly different every year. But I also think there’s something about the Victorian age that just fits Doctor Who, somehow.

We did the filming in Gloucester- instead of Cardiff, where we usually film - because it has so many Victorian streets. But one of the obstacles now has become filming with David Tennant, because he gathers a crowd wherever he goes.

It’s extraordinary. I mean, the man’s a star. And he handles it so beautifully; he’s so brilliant with the public, but it does eat up our time! It makes filming that much slower and more laborious.

About 400 people turned up in Gloucester. This would never happen in Cardiff because we’re there all the time and people are quite used to us. In fact, they’ve become a bit blasé. Gloucester was lovely, though, absolutely beautiful, and the city was so willing to let us close off streets.

[ Other behind-the-scenes photosets are available here ]
trail.content:
Behind the Scenes of The Next Doctor (Part 9)

Russell T. Davies, as interviewed by Paul Connolly for The Daily Mail:

I’m not entirely sure why I was so determined to set this special in Victorian times. Partly, it’s that we haven’t done a Christmas show set in the past before - they tend to be in the present or the future - and I try to make it slightly different every year. But I also think there’s something about the Victorian age that just fits Doctor Who, somehow.

We did the filming in Gloucester- instead of Cardiff, where we usually film - because it has so many Victorian streets. But one of the obstacles now has become filming with David Tennant, because he gathers a crowd wherever he goes.

It’s extraordinary. I mean, the man’s a star. And he handles it so beautifully; he’s so brilliant with the public, but it does eat up our time! It makes filming that much slower and more laborious.

About 400 people turned up in Gloucester. This would never happen in Cardiff because we’re there all the time and people are quite used to us. In fact, they’ve become a bit blasé. Gloucester was lovely, though, absolutely beautiful, and the city was so willing to let us close off streets.

blog.name: whovianfloozy
blog.title: The Whovian Floozy
blog.description:
My fandom name is Beachy, and this is a multi-fandom blog. 
I'm also a multi-shipper. It's likely I do not sail your ship, but I don't wank and expect visitors to play nicely as well. That includes not adding hate or negativity to my posts, altering them to suit your own ships, or removing my original comments. If you do, you will be blocked.
IRL they call me Doctor. Yep, I'm that old. Sometimes I write things that other people watch. It's all good! I like mocha latte with bourbon. A lot.

blog.description:
**NSFW blogs WILL BE BLOCKED!**

My name is Kai and my birthday is March 4 1991. DALLAS, TEXAS. Pisces. Coping with anxiety and depression. I like memes a lot. I use this blog to whine so be prepared.

summary: I had a dream last night that I was back in my old house (I live north of Dallas Fort Worth airport in Texas) and David Tennant...
body: I had a dream last night that I was back in my old house (I live north of Dallas Fort Worth airport in Texas) and David Tennant lived in a house two streets away from me and for some reason also Ariana Grande was buying my small four bedroom circa late 1980s one story house and while she was in the process of moving in I was also trying to intercept David but couldn’t and then even though they all did it for some type of “small town anonymity” Ariana ended up have a big ass party. I don’t even like Ariana Grande.
